intro: Iris gmelinii, commonly known as the Siberian iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wet meadows, riverbanks, and marshy areas, showcasing its adaptability to aquatic environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and water feature plantings.
